intro: Xanthisma gymnocephalum, commonly known as the naked-headed xanthisma, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. Xanthisma gymnocephalum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
